name: The Leela Palace Bangalore

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days and I liked the hotel. However I did not liked their food. It is a Seven Star hotel and you expect some good teast food same as Taj Palce in Delhi but was not happy with it. We reached their some where around 12 mid night and asked the reception that if they have any place to eat in the hotel and they said no. But next day we came to know that their is 24 hr restaurant on the 11 or some top floor in the hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not good service

reviews.text: People are not as friendly as we had in Taj Palace in Delhi. So staff in Leela, please smile when you see you guest.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms, excellent service, regal experience
A wonderful place to recreate from business
reviews.text: Thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. Reception was warm and service was excellent throughout my stay. Both the room and bathroom were huge and comfortable. My only room complaint is that the desk and chair were very traditional (no adjustable task chairs) so it was nearly impossible to work on a laptop at the desk - which I found ironic in a hotel in the tech hub of India. Restaurants were good but nothing exceptional. The bar atmosphere was a little too formal for my tastes thus I only went once. If you love to throw away your money, you'll love the attached shopping mall. I found it to be way overpriced. As another reviewer stated - it is a refuge from the congestion of Bangalore. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Had it been anywhere else in the world...

reviews.text: I've spent three days days in the Leela Palace while on a business trip n India.
reviews.title: Service Second to None

reviews.text: Stayed for one night here after we came to Bangalore for a shopping trip. Hotel was gorgeous and staff we outstanding. Room was beautiful and modern with great food at the restaurants. Service was superb with staff helping us locate the stores we wanted to visit. WOuld def stay there again.
reviews.title: Great hotel and service

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Leela a number of times over about 10 years. The quality of the staff, the facility and the food continue to be outstanding and bring me back each time. I have noticed in the last couple of years that it will soon be time for maintenance on the rooms. I must say as well that when I've needed help (eg malfunctioning light) I need to be patient and operate at the pace of the local culture. However one needs to adjust to this in any location you visit. I find this a special place from which to have an opportunity to visit India.
reviews.title: Wonderful place from which to work and enjoy the city

reviews.text: Have stayed at Leela some 4-5 times by now. The starting couple of stays were not a pleasant experience but once feedback was provided, the entire management and staff worked hard to ensure that the experience improved. Kudos to Andrew Hendrian and team for a superlative response to customer issues.
reviews.title: They know their business!

reviews.text: Now I can say, stay at Leela Palace and feel like a KING!!
reviews.title: The best since creation

reviews.text: This is by far the best as far as luxury is concerned in Bangalore.Holds a prime spot in the city. This beautiful structure is always welcoming unlike the rest of the high graded hotels in the city. Jamavar is an amazing restaurant with rich Indian cuisine. The north Indian food spread is worth every dime. Citrus, the 24 hr coffee shop is fantastic too. If luxury means anything to you, this is your place in Bangalore.
reviews.title: An oasis in Bangalore

reviews.text: I have visited this place more than couple dozens times and have always experienced something new. They have good variety of restaurants with amazing food. The club Athena is one of the best in Bangalore with good parties specially over weekends. I just love this place.
reviews.title: Good Restaurants

reviews.text: I have stayed at Leela atleast half a dozen times and never had even an iota of trouble. Spacious elegant Rooms, Courteous Staff, Extra Large Bathrooms, excellent restaurants, Big swimming Pool - All these add to that extra edge which Leela has over Oberoi and any other hotels in Bangalore. There is also a mall inside the Hotel Property and a Barista Coffee House that is open 24 hours.
reviews.title: Guaranteed Excellence in Service

reviews.text: I have stayed in here in March and would say it is an excellent property with a very nice staff though as in every Leela hotel in India. The lobby and reception is amazing. This waiting space is one of the best,. cosy I've experienced ever and perfect for a tea time. Rooms are not very big, but perfectly furnitured in a luxurious indian style. Food is excellent - you can have a real beef stake, and not veal as everywhere. the chese plate is has a big variety.
reviews.title: luxurious but very far away from airport

reviews.text: This property has the feel of royalty and rightly so, puts a price tag that is tad too expensive for stay or food. For an independent traveler - it is not a property worth exploring, if paid by business - definitely worth the effort to explore each detail, a lot of effort is put into design and maintenance. Good Choice of Food but heavily priced again.
reviews.title: Good Property - Slightly overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Leela Palace's grand entrance, plush reception sofas and luxurious rooms can really lead you to believe you're staying in a palace.
reviews.title: Live like royalty

reviews.text: This is a fabulous property- fab in all ways possible. The location, to its gardens, to its interiors, staff, food- once just can't get over the experience! Fabulous experience.....a must visit location for people traveling to bangalore.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.text: A palace indeed, very aesthetic and gorgeous! Marble everywhere u feel like a King when u are staying here! Amazing spread of food over buffet counters! Staff is not very friendly but this is definitely one of the best hotels in India worth visiting just for it's architecture! Good location close to happening indiranagar. Nice banquet halls to hold conferences etc And let me add an amazing spa that blew my mind away! Totally spoil yourself and indulge in this palace and feel like a queen! shopping is average inside this hotel. The library bar is luxurious and ballin'! A good night club could do extremely well in this hotel, from my understanding they had one which shut due to some reason! But what a beauty!
reviews.title: Beautiful in every sense of the word!

reviews.text: Beyond all, the service is amazing - friendly, helpful, accommodating. Rooms are very comfortable, the bar is great, so is the fitness.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong staying here

reviews.text: The pool is big enough for serious swimming, the restaurants delicious.
reviews.title: Service second to none

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Leela at least a dozen times over the last 7 years and while gradually "shows it's age", especially in the halls (please replace the smelly carpets someday)....the rooms are wonderfully elegant but comfortable, impeccably clean, and the service -- well, it is the best I've experienced at any hotel. The staff is friendly; the restaurant hostess remembers your name after a day or so...
reviews.title: Paradise, but not quite

aka: The Leela Palace Bangalore Hotel Bangalore
